law.catch_line: Recording of options or offers to sell.
law.text: Any option or offer to sell real or other property, or any interest therein, when acknowledged or proven as deeds are required to be, may be recorded in the county in which the property is situated, in the same offices in which deeds are recorded, and in a separate book kept for that purpose, and the record of all such recorded options or offers to sell, shall, from the time of lodging them for record, be notice of such contracts to all persons.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 494a.
